intro: Boronia dentigeroides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved boronia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are narrow and serrated, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Boronia dentigeroides is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
